decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then bring them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The key strategy is to cheat big creatures into play early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats. Additionally, cards like Cabal Therapy and Unmask help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ensuring the combo can go off smoothly. The deck focuses on using the graveyard as a resource to quickly win the game.

The key concept of this deck is to establish board presence quickly with efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Knight of the Reliquary, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Heretic Cathar and Gaddock Teeg. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to provide additional threats and control the battlefield. The mana base is focused on fetching important lands like Gaea's Cradle and Karakas, while also disrupting the opponent's mana sources with cards like Wasteland.

The primary aim of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while utilizing cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote to draw through the deck quickly and play numerous elves in a single turn. This deck focuses on a combo-based strategy to overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence and finish the game with cards like Craterhoof Behemoth or Ezuri, Renegade Leader, granting all elves trample and overrun. The key strategy revolves around creating a powerful and explosive elf synergy on the battlefield.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Eldrazi creatures. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple, as well as disruption from Chalice of the Void and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent while quickly deploying powerful threats such as Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Eldrazi Displacer. The inclusion of utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland further enhances the deck's ability to control the game and dictate the pace of play.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of counterspells, hand disruption spells, removal spells, and creatures that can counter spells or disrupt the opponent's plays. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and tempo with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Bitterblossom, while using efficient spells like Fatal Push and Brainstorm to control the board. With a mix of blue, black, and colorless mana sources, the deck aims to have a solid mana base to support its control strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and artifacts onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. The key strategy involves using cards like Ensoul Artifact and The Antiquities War to power up artifacts and quickly close out the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to control the game and protect its own threats. With a mix of efficient artifact creatures and powerful artifact spells, this deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt opponents in equal measure.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently put a powerful creature like Griselbrand into play from the graveyard using various spells like Entomb, Exhume, and Reanimate. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Unmask to protect the combo, as well as ways to generate mana quickly like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond. Burning Wish can be used to tutor for specific cards from the sideboard, adding flexibility to the deck's strategy. The goal is to assemble the combo as quickly as possible and overwhelm the opponent with a massive threat.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Chalice of the Void, while also quickly ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent with efficient threats like Eldrazi Mimic and Matter Reshaper, while also having resilient options like Eternal Scourge. The deck's strategy revolves around quickly deploying threats and overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize or establish their own game plan.

The main focus of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro-Burn deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by utilizing direct damage spells such as Lightning Bolt, Fireblast, Rift Bolt, Lava Spike, Flame Rift, and Chain Lightning. The creatures in the deck, Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel, supplement the burn spells by attacking for additional damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells to win the game as quickly as possible.

The main concept of this Infect combo deck is to quickly deal 10 poison counters to the opponent by using creatures with infect abilities and pump spells like Berserk and Invigorate. The deck also includes protection spells like Force of Will and Daze, as well as mana ramp with Noble Hierarch. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, aiming to win the game before the opponent can establish a defense. It also includes some interaction with cards like Spell Pierce and Viridian Corrupter to handle opposing threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies by using disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, while also ramping up its own board presence with Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice. The deck also utilizes land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to slow down opponents. It aims to control the board while applying pressure through its aggressive creatures and equipment, ultimately grinding out a win through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this Legacy Show and Tell combo deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play by casting Show and Tell, allowing you to bypass their high mana cost. The deck runs a low land count and relies on acceleration such as Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to enable this strategy. It also includes countermagic like Spell Pierce and Force of Will to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. This deck aims to win the game by executing its combo before the opponent can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on generating as much mana as possible in order to cast a large number of spells in a single turn to build up storm count and ultimately win the game with Tendrils of Agony. The deck includes a variety of mana-generating spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, as well as card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder to help find combo pieces quickly. Thoughtseize and Duress help protect the combo from disruption, while Infernal Tutor and Dark Petition allow for tutoring key combo pieces.

This Goblins deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to use cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial to cheat out powerful Goblin creatures while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. With a mix of efficient beaters like Goblin Piledriver and card advantage engines like Goblin Ringleader, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card manipulation. It utilizes cards like Counterbalance, Force of Will, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to disrupt the opponent's plans and maintain board control. The deck also includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Predict to ensure consistency. Additionally, the deck has win conditions in the form of Monastery Mentor and Entreat the Angels, allowing the player to close out the game once they have stabilized.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Eldrazi lands like Cloudpost and Eye of Ugin, along with artifacts like Thran Dynamo and Grim Monolith. This allows for early plays of powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to control the opponent's spells. Endbringer provides additional utility, while cards like All Is Dust and Walking Ballista serve as removal options. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast mana and big threats.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible, using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Into the North to find the necessary pieces. It also includes protection in the form of Pithing Needle and Duress, as well as backup plans like Vampire Hexmage and Sylvan Safekeeper. The goal is to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token by removing all ice counters from Dark Depths with Thespian's Stage, allowing for a fast and powerful win condition against opponents in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck revolves around the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to quickly mill the opponent's library. The main goal is to assemble the combo pieces using Imperial Recruiter and Enlightened Tutor while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Red Elemental Blast and Ethersworn Canonist. The deck also features control elements like Pyroblast and Ensnaring Bridge to protect the combo. Additional threats like Walking Ballista and Goblin Welder provide versatility in dealing with different types of matchups. With a fast and disruptive game plan, the deck aims to win quickly through its combo.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Death's Shadow, and Gurmag Angler to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Spell Pierce, and Daze to control the board and protect its threats. By using cards like Reanimate and Street Wraith to manipulate its life total, the deck can quickly power up a massive Death's Shadow for a game-ending swing. The deck also includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and keep the pressure on the opponent.
